alignments.name: Level 3 Certificate in Domestic Retrofit Advice
alignments.description: The role of a Retrofit Advisor is all about customer service and engagement, making the complex process of retrofit less uncomfortable and more achievable for customers. A Level 3 Award in Domestic Retrofit Advice course lasts 4-5 days and is ideal for housing professionals becoming more heavily involved in retrofit projects.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has developed their knowledge of the Role of Retrofit in home energy consumption, providing them with all they need to know about climate change, the importance and meaning of retrofit, fuel poverty and the role of a Retrofit Advisor.

Earner has completed Retrofit Principles to learn the basics of construction and building services, energy efficiency and heat loss, retrofit measures and technologies, and the major risks in retrofitting.

Earner has demonstrated their understanding of the principles of Retrofit advice, and the skills and knowledge needed to do the job properly. This includes site visits, health and safety, common challenges in retrofit and energy efficiency, and how to deliver good retrofit advice.

Earner has demonstrated their understanding of the Retrofit Industry and the role of advisors. Earner has gained knowledge on the organisations involved in retrofit, the funding and grants available, the typical retrofit customer journey, and PAS 2035.
Earner has engaged with a range of learning mediums including online learning workshops, mock tests, boot camps and has completed a final test.

Earner has completed an employment placement where they have applied their learning in a workplace setting. They have received and actioned feedback on their work. Earner has gained relevant work experience to enable them to work confidently in this sector.
By application, please contact the provider for more information
Belfast City Council, Donegall Square North, City Hall, Belfast, BT1 5GS

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has developed basic knowledge of digital tools and applications available to create a CV and cover letter. Earner has also learnt how to effectively prepare to write a CV and cover letter through online research. They understand how to grab the reader's attention, how to stand out from the crowd, how to highlight skills that are required for the job, and how to match the language and tone of voice of a company’s brand.

Earner has learnt how to structure a CV, and how to identify and highlight strengths, skills, and experiences that are relevant to the job they are applying for. Earner has developed knowledge of the framework and template of a good CV and cover letter and understands how to tailor their application for varying roles and sectors.
Earner has developed their understanding of how to effectively identify and apply their transferable skills to support their employability journey and how to apply this to their CV and cover letter.

This session has helped earners prepare for a range of interview formats such as online interviews, platform interviews, face-to-face interviews and assessment centres. Earners have also learnt the importance of communication and how to communicate both verbally and non-verbally.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has developed knowledge of a range of Interview types and formats, including telephone, face-to-face, live video, and pre-recorded interviews and assessment centres.

Earner has learnt about the purpose of an interview, how to prepare for questions and the most popular questions. This workshop also includes competencies-based questions and how to formulate an answer using the STARB method (Situation, Task, Action, Results, Benefits).

Earner has understood how to prepare and plan for an interview. This includes researching the company prior to the interview, preparing their journey and travelling to an interview, familiarising themselves with the location, knowing and the time required for travel. For an online interview, making sure that they log on early to ensure technology does not fail.

Earner has learnt how to have good and positive body language. Earner has also explored what non-verbal communication could be saying to the interview panel and how to avoid giving off negative body language. Earner has also understood the importance of appropriate interview clothing and what that says to employers.

Earner has completed mock interviews will a panel helping them to practice answers and eliminate verbal tics. Earner knows how to give a clear delivery of answers along with how to stay calm under pressure. Earners have received feedback on their mock interviews to help them improve and practice boosting their performance for the real interview.
Earner has been given tips on breathing techniques helping them to remain calm and relaxed in the interview which will maximise their interview performance.
This badge is open to all.

Earner has developed knowledge of how algorithms work within a job board and how to automate the job search as much as possible, save searches and receive notifications on sectors of interest.
